title: Engine File Count Reconciliation
verdict: RECONCILED — 191 .ts files in src/engines/: 169 *Engine.ts + 7 *Executor.ts + 6 legacy-named engines + 7 infrastructure/utility + 2 meta-files. True engine count: 182.

engine_ts_files.note: Matches QA-MS0 verified count of 169 engines exactly

legacy_named_engines.note: Functional engines with non-standard naming (no 'Engine' suffix)

files.purpose: Core cutting force, tool life, speed/feed calculations

infrastructure_utility.note: Support modules that are NOT standalone engines

discrepancy_explanation.milestone_claim_74: From early documentation (pre-QA). Undercounted by 59% — only counted core manufacturing engines.
discrepancy_explanation.qa_ms0_verified_169: QA-MS0 counted *Engine.ts pattern = 169. Correct for that pattern.
discrepancy_explanation.milestone_estimate_175: Rough estimate in QA-MS11 envelope. Close but under by 16.
discrepancy_explanation.actual_191: Full count including executors (7), legacy names (6), infrastructure (7), and meta-files (2).
discrepancy_explanation.true_functional_engines: 182 functional engine/executor modules. 169 from QA-MS0 was accurate for *Engine.ts; adding executors and legacy-named gives 182.
